continues as{{Jct|state=SK|Hwy|167}} |cities=[[Brandon, Manitoba|Brandon]], [[Dauphin, Manitoba|Dauphin]], [[The Pas, Manitoba|The Pas]], [[Flin Flon, Manitoba|Flin Flon]] |towns=[[Boissevain, Manitoba|Boissevain]], [[Minnedosa, Manitoba|Minnedosa]], [[Erickson, Manitoba|Erickson]], [[Wasagaming, Manitoba|Clear Lake]], [[Ethelbert, Manitoba|Ethelbert]], [[Swan River, Manitoba|Swan River]], [[Cranberry Portage, Manitoba|Cranberry Portage]] |established= |previous_type=Hwy |previous_route=9A |next_type=Hwy |next_route=10A }} '''Provincial Trunk Highway 10''' (PTH 10) is a north-south highway that runs from the [[North Dakota]] border at the [[International Peace Garden]] near [[Boissevain, Manitoba|Boissevain]], north through [[Brandon, Manitoba|Brandon]], [[Dauphin, Manitoba|Dauphin]], [[Swan River, Manitoba|Swan River]], and [[The Pas, Manitoba|The Pas]] to the [[Saskatchewan]] boundary at [[Flin Flon, Manitoba|Flin Flon]]. The speed limit is 100 km/h. Between [[Dauphin, Manitoba|Dauphin]] and [[The Pas, Manitoba|The Pas]], Highway 10 is designated as the '''[[Northern Woods and Water Route]]'''. At 847 km (526 mi) in length, PTH 10 is currently the longest highway in the province of Manitoba.{{cite map |publisher = Microsoft Corporation Redmond Washington |title = Microsoft Streets and Tips |url = |edition = 2004 |section = |accessdate = 2008-02-10}}{{cite web | url = http://www.planetware.com/canada/northern-woods-and-water-route-cdn-bc-nwwr.htm | title = Northern Woods and Water Route, Canada | date =1995-2009 | publisher = PlanetWare Inc }} ==Travel Route== This is the travel route for Manitoba Highway 10 (PTH 10). This list is routed from south to north, starting at the US-Canada border to the Manitoba-Saskatchewan border. ===US - Canada border to Brandon=== {| class="wikitable sortable" !km !Municipality
